\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{initialize()}{initialize()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \label{socket_8h_a6913fe6ca77eb944670d69db715c09c0} 
void sockpp\+::initialize (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}{}{}\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Initializes the sockpp library. 

This initializes the library by creating a static singleton RAII object which does any platform-\/specific initialization the first time it\textquotesingle{}s call in a process, and then performs cleanup automatically when the object is destroyed at program termination.

This should be call at least once before any other sockpp objects are created or used. It can be called repeatedly with subsequent calls having no effect

This is primarily required for Win32, to startup the Win\+Sock DLL.

On Unix-\/style platforms it disables SIGPIPE signals. Errors are handled by functon return values and exceptions. \Hypertarget{socket_8h_aff4e33d511649686d999f969c67d2554}\index{socket.h@{socket.h}!to\_duration@{to\_duration}}
